text: the Trump administration says it will
recognize Jerusalem as Israel's capital
here's why that matters
Jerusalem is holy to three major
religions
it's where Solomon built the first
Jewish temple where Christ was crucified
and where the Prophet Muhammad ascended
into heaven today it's one of the core
issues in the israeli-palestinian
conflict Israel says Jerusalem is its
capital including East Jerusalem which
is occupied since 1967 the Palestinians
say East Jerusalem is their capital
Palestinians and their supporters say
that if the u.s. recognizes Jerusalem as
Israel's it cannot be an honest peace
broker that would be actually the kiss
of death to the two-state solution
because euro Salam is at the very heart
of the two-state solution for decades US
administrations have said the city's
status must be decided by peace talks
and that moving the embassy to Jerusalem
would be taking Israel's side in the
first few months of his presidency Trump
had kept that tradition even at the
expense of a campaign promised we will
move the American Embassy
to the eternal capital of the Jewish
people Jerusalem but at the start of
this week he missed a legal deadline to
sign the presidential waiver that would
delay the embassy move the Palestinians
have made it very clear that moving the
US embassy or even just recognizing
Jerusalem as Israel's capital would be
unacceptable to them other world and
regional leaders have also strongly
warned against it one argument is that a
city that has already been fought over
for centuries
would better serve now as a place of
peace
